intro: Nemophila sepulta var. minutiflora, commonly known as the dwarf blue-eyed Mary, is a low-growing annual plant native to California. It produces small, sky-blue flowers with white centers, typically blooming in early spring. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine绒毛, giving it a soft texture. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and wildflower mixes. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to naturalize in suitable climates.
